page.title: 17Redingensians Rugby Club.
page.content: The first game was played about 60 years ago when a group of boys who had left school decided to carry on playing. They named the team{Old {Redingensians. Their playing ground is by the A4 in Sonning.It covers several acres and includes cricket and rugby pitches. There isn't a membership fee but you can pay Â£5 to be a non-playing member. The club has 200 junior & senior members who play for pleasure and competition. Minor injuries are common although one boy has had a broken leg. If the club wins 24 out of 34 matches, it has been a good season. There are 6/7 trophies which members can keep for a year.
